ordinary people as a group, rather than people who are rich, powerful, or members of the clergy (= priests): The nobility often possessed extensive powers over the commonalty. He told them that the commonalty was on their side. The commonalty were allowed a council of fifty, which had to agree with the mayor's decisions.
